bill_title: provide for permanent daylight savings time.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to exempt South Dakota from daylight savings time. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 1-1 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The State of South Dakota is exempted from daylights savings time pursuant to the provisions of 15 U.S.C. § 260a. This section may not be construed to affect the standard time established under federal law governing the movements of common carriers engaged in interstate commerce or the time for performance of an act by an officer or department of the United States, as established by a statute, lawful order, rule, or regulation of the United States or any agency of the United States. This Act is effective as of the effective date of the enactment of legislation that exempts the state from daylight savings time by the sixth of the six states that border South Dakota. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for permanent daylight savings time. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 1-1 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The State of South Dakota is in permanent daylights savings time pursuant to the provisions of 15 U.S.C. § 260a. This section may not be construed to affect the standard time established under federal law governing the movements of common carriers engaged in interstate commerce or the time for performance of an act by an officer or department of the United States, as established by a statute, lawful order, rule, or regulation of the United States or any agency of the United States. This Act is effective as of the effective date of the enactment of legislation that permanently adopts daylight savings time by the sixth of the six states that border South Dakota. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
